body: file does not exist on s3
it is the first field in the dataframe
i think it also happens if there is a letter in a long/double datatype

so IIUC you think the field is there in all records but we cant still find it? Can you trim your example and give me a code snippet to reproducs this? For eg dump dataframe to csv and share code showing how you are reading it for hudi writing?

File format def looks like something generated by hudi. This cannot happen in general, unless you are reading files without using hudi’s read path. 


Again, with these things reproducing the issue is the key. Can you comment on reproducibility.. does it happen on master as well
Dont recall.. it was few versions ago. But master and 0.4.7 contains significant fixes to handle spark stage retry failure issues in the backdrop of s3

Hi @vinothchandar thanks for your reply:

> top level comment.. I see we have pretty much copied over the english content onto the .cn.md files here.. In relation to chinese docs, do you plan to rewrite these .md files one by one? whats the plan here? If not, I am wondering if there is a simpler way to provide chinese nav bars alone

This plugin needs the naming style of `xxx.cn.md` if we need to provide a Chinese doc version for `xxx.md`. IMO, it's a good way to decouple the other language doc with the English doc. It's a good choice, Apache Flink and Kylin also chose it. Trust me, I will try my best to maintain the Chinese doc. The plan is described in issue HUDI-211. When we start the translation, one document one subtask. I will help to translate and review those docs.

> The theme changes look good - removing github-pages etc.. On `include` , does it mean we no longer have the ability to include html files ? I was actually hoping to use them to redo parts of the demo page.

Unfortunately, I have tried to figure out why it does not allow `include` grammar in `.md` files. But I am not a Jekyll and ruby expert, I can not find the reason. Coincidentally, I also do not find `include` grammar been used in the `.md` file of Flink docs. However, we still can use this grammar in `.html` file. 

IMO, it's not a serious question, we can find a good solution to reuse the partial page. In addition, I will also try to refactor the structure of the document with one menu one folder, I think it's a better way to host more and more docs. If you agree with this opinion.

>>When we start the translation, one document one subtask. I will help to translate and review those docs.
makes sense. thats what I was trying to confirm.

#846, and #850 have made most of this PR redundant.

@vinothchandar @bvaradar do we still want to bump to Spark 2.4 minimum (+ associated avro/parquet)?

**I can see a few reasons why we still might want to do this:**
* To use spark-avro from core spark, instead of databricks (Introduced in Spark 2.4)
  * This also lets us move to AVRO 1.8.2, which introduced support for [logical types](https://avro.apache.org/docs/1.8.2/spec.html#Logical+Types).
* To use the Datasource V2 API (Introduced in Spark 2.3)
I will try to reproduce this and report back.
@bvaradar Tip: I have been using "squash and merge"  option which lets you control commit message and also squashes automatically

yes its still in the plan. Actually, with cleanups to pom from @thesuperzapper and me already merged to master, its good time to start on this, if anyone has cycles.

After that, this is next on my plate - test across spark versions 2.1 - 2.4 and ensure things still work.

Is it possible for you to switch to other jvms? trying to understand what you are trying to achieve.
Switching to another JVM is not possible. The environment in which I have to run the code cannot be changed.

To give more context, hudi is being used as one dependency of a larger codebase that is intended to run on multiple environments, one of which uses the IBM SDK as a JVM. After hudi was included in the codebase, behaviour became inconsistent between environments using OpenJDK and IBM SDK, which was eventually traced to inconsistent hudi behaviour between environments. While investigating this, the hudi unit test failures seemed the clearest demonstration of this inconsistency between JVMs, and so was used when creating the issue.

@vinothchandar @bvaradar Thanks for the review, addressed the comments and squashed the commits. And two things to point out. First when running mvn notice:generate  from top-level module, the notice file(NOTICE.txt and HUDI_NOTICE.txt) in other modules(such as hudi-hadoop-mr and packaging/hudi-hadoop-mr-bundle) have been modified, so should we open anthor PR to update NOTICE file? And i am willing to do this work. Second. In windows environment, running mvn notice:generate gets the following exception:

/incubator-hudi/release/config/license-mappings.xml

And it can be fix by removing _file://_ in configuration, and it works well in windows and linux. So should i file another jira ticket to track it?

Please take a look at POM for other modules to see if there are other such examples

Thanks again Vinoth. I think I know the reason why you are not seeing the issue. If you could kindly include partition in your setup, you should see the issue too. As I suggested in the initial report, this issue is only reproduced if there is a partitioned hive table involved. 

Steps: (Let the schema be: id, name, team)

1. Insert data into certain partition (eg: p1) -> (1, kabeer, hudi | 2, vinoth, hudi)
2. Delete record (1, kabeer, hudi)
3. Upsert a new record: (3, balaji, hudi)

Please treat the partition column as team column and kindly ensure that the hive table partition path in which all the 3 records should be <base_path_of_table>/team. 

Now when you query the table. You should expect to see the records vinoth and balaji. But you would only see balaji. 

Some additional information based on your setup:
I have repeated the above test setup by making partition column as id column - i.e. all the records land in their own partition columns based on their ID - so kabeer lands in partition 1, vinoth in 2 and balaji in partition 3. 
Since the record that gets deleted is kabeer, I am successfully able to see Vinoth and Balaji. So I am now convinced that for a table in a given partition, an upsert followed by delete will cause all previous records to vanish away. 

More information:
The upsert routine that I use after insert and delete is the same. I can confirm that upserts after insert land me with expected behaviour which goes on to indicate that I am not doing savemode.overwrite It is only after delete that there is an issue. 

Hopefully when you extend your setup with partition information of the table, we can confirm that the issue exists. I am very grateful to you for all  your support. Eagerly looking forward to see your further findings.
